plugin.name: ðŸ§¹ Tidy Up
plugin.author: jgclark
plugin.description: Tidy up and delete various things in your NotePlan notes
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
v0.8.0: new command: Move top-level tasks in Editor to heading
v0.7.0: new command: /Remove >today tags from completed todos
v0.6.0: new commands 'Remove empty notes' 'List conflicted notes' + display improvements.
v0.5.0: new 'list duplicate notes' command.
0.4.0: adds command to tidy up triggers in older calendar notes, and way to change settings on iOS.

plugin.commands.name: Tidy Up
plugin.commands.description: Run as many of the other commands in this plugin as you have configured.

plugin.commands.name: File root-level notes
plugin.commands.description: For each root-level note, asks which folder you'd like it moved to. (There's a setting for ones to ignore.)

plugin.commands.name: List duplicate notes
plugin.commands.description: List (in a new NP note) potentially duplicate notes because they have identical titles

plugin.commands.name: List conflicted notes
plugin.commands.description: List (in a new NP note) all notes on this device that have conflicts. (Requires NP v3.9.3)

plugin.commands.name: Remove @done() markers
plugin.commands.description: Remove @done() markers from recently-updated notes. Can be used with parameters from Template or Callback.

plugin.commands.name: Remove blank notes
plugin.commands.description: Remove notes that are completely empty, or just have a `#` character

plugin.commands.name: Remove orphaned blockIDs
plugin.commands.description: Remove blockIDs from lines that had been sync'd, but are 'orphans' as the other copies of the blockID have since been deleted.

plugin.commands.name: Remove time parts from @done() dates
plugin.commands.description: Remove time parts of @done(date time) from recently-updated notes. Can be used with parameters from Template or Callback.

plugin.commands.name: Remove section from recent notes
plugin.commands.description:
Remove a given section (both the heading and its content) from recently-changed notes.
Can be used with parameters from Template or x-callback.

plugin.commands.name: Remove section from all notes
plugin.commands.description:
Remove a given section (both the heading and its content) from all notes.
Can be used with parameters from Template or x-callback.

plugin.commands.name: Remove triggers from recent calendar notes
plugin.commands.description:
Remove one or more triggers from recent (but past) calendar notes.
Can be used with parameters from Template or x-callback.

plugin.commands.name: Log notes changed in interval (Tidy)
plugin.commands.description: Write a list of Log notes changed in the last interval of days to the plugin log. It will default to the 'Default Recent Time Interval' setting unless passed as a parameter.

plugin.commands.name: Remove >today tags from completed todos
plugin.commands.description: Remove Completed todos that have a >today tag. Can be used with parameters from Template or Callback.

plugin.commands.name: Tidy: Move top-level tasks in Editor to heading
plugin.commands.description: Tasks at top of active note (prior to any heading) will be placed under a specified heading
arguments: Heading name to place the tasks under (will be created if doesn't exist). If you are running this command in a template, put any non-blank text in the field below.
Run silently (e.g. in a template). Default is false.
Return the content of the tasks text, rather than inserting under a heading (e.g. for inserting in a tempate)

plugin.settings.title: Which notes to ignore?
plugin.settings.description:
Comma-separated list of note titles that you need or want to leave in the root folder. These will be ignored when running the command.
Note: the '# ' is not part of the title, so don't include it.

plugin.settings.title: Filepath for results note
plugin.settings.description: The filepath (including any NP folders) of which NotePlan note to use. (Default: 'Conflicted Notes.md')

plugin.settings.title: Filepath for results
plugin.settings.description: The filepath (including any NP folders) of which NotePlan note to use. (Default: 'Duplicate Notes.md')

plugin.settings.title: How many days count as recent?
plugin.settings.description: The number of days to look back for 'recently changed' notes. If this is 0 or empty, then all notes will be checked.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of folders to exclude in the '/Remove ...' commands. May be empty.

plugin.settings.title: Just remove @done(...) markers from checklists?
plugin.settings.description: When removing @done(...) markers, remove just from done checklist items, not done tasks as well? (This is relevant when calculating heatmaps of when tasks but not checklists are completed in Summaries plugin.)

plugin.settings.title: Type of match for section headings
plugin.settings.description: The 'Starts with' setting allows headings that always start the same (e.g. 'Habit Progress') to be matched, even if the end of the heading changes (e.g. 'Habit Progress for Tuesday').

plugin.settings.title: '/Move top-level tasks in Editor...' command settings
Heading name for '/Move top-level tasks in Editor to heading' command
plugin.settings.description:
When "/Move top-level tasks in Editor to heading" is run, this is the name of the heading to move the tasks under. If the heading doesn't exist in the current Editor note, it will be created.
NOTE: If you leave this blank, you will be prompted for the heading to move the tasks under at run-time.

plugin.settings.title: '/Tidy Up' command: which commands to run?
Run commands silently?
plugin.settings.description:
When running commands silently, they will run entirely in the background and not pop up dialogs to check or report success. Only turn this on when you're comfortable that the commands are doing what you expect.
Note: If you run in this mode, then details will be written to the Plugin Console at level 'INFO' instead.

plugin.settings.title: Run '/Remove time parts from @done() dates' command?
Run '/Remove triggers from recent calendar notes?
Run '/Move top-level tasks in Editor to heading?
plugin.settings.description: Note: this command does not work like the other commands inside a template (e.g. your daily template). See plugin README for how to run this command in a daily template.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Tidy commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs

plugin.settings_disabled.title: Run '/Remove section from recent notes' command?
plugin.settings_disabled.ddescription: Note: the '/Remove section from all notes' command is deliberately not available, given how dangerous it could be.
